-  Based on their position on the table, elements can be classified as metals, nonmetals, and metalloids.  Elements in rows 2 through 10 are metals, elements in rows 11 through 18 are nonmetals, and elements in rows 3 through 8 and electrons and are called metalloids.  This classification is useful for predicting many of the properties and chemistry of elements.
-  The periodic table is organized a certain way for many reasons, but arguably the most important is so that it is easy to compare the properties and behaviors of various elements, and so that you can easily predict many of their properties. chosen: There are currently no cures for Raynaud’s; however, there are drugs that can help relieve symptoms by increasing blood flow in Raynaud’s-affected areas. It’s important to note, however, that Raynaud’s symptoms can be very difficult to completely eliminate, and patients may still experience occasional numbness and pain despite receiving therapy.
